markdownRemark.html: Modulus Found a number of thousands, hundreds, tens and ones int number = 1234; int thousands = number / 1000; NSLog ("@The thousands place of %d is %d.", number, thousands); int hundreds = (number % 1000) / 100; NSLog ("@The hundreds place of %d is %d.", number, hundreds); int tens = ((number % 1000) % 100) / 10; NSLog (@"The tens place of %d is %d.", number, tens); int ones = (((number % 1000) % 100) % 10); NSLog (@"The ones place of %d is %d.", number, ones); This is another practical use of the modulus operator - to limit the range of a result to a specific set of numbers. (('H' * 2) % 127), (('e' * 2) % 127), (('l' * 2) % 127), (('l' * 2) % 127), (('o' * 2) % 127)); Make string uppercase "fifa".bytes.map { |n| n - 32 }.map(&:chr).join and downcase "DOWN".bytes.map { |n| n + 32 }.map(&:chr).join
